figurative_meaning: Two things that are closely related or dependent on each other.
example: Their friendship is bagaikan aur dengan tebing; they always support each other.
Their relationship proves that cinta tidak mengenal usia.

literal_meaning: Water that is chopped will not break.
figurative_meaning: Family ties are strong and cannot be easily severed.
example: Even after their arguments, they will always reconcile; air dicincang tidak akan putus.

idiom: Bersatu kita teguh, bercerai kita runtuh
literal_meaning: United we stand, divided we fall.
example: In times of crisis, we must remember that bersatu kita teguh, bercerai kita runtuh.

idiom: Jangan seperti katak di bawah tempurung
literal_meaning: Don't be like a frog under a coconut shell.
figurative_meaning: Don't be narrow-minded or unaware of the world around you.
example: You need to travel more; jangan seperti katak di bawah tempurung.

literal_meaning: When something breaks, it grows back and is replaced.
figurative_meaning: Loss can be compensated by new beginnings.
example: When she lost her job, she found a better one quickly; patah tumbuh hilang berganti.

literal_meaning: After sweetness, the peel is thrown away.
figurative_meaning: People often discard others once they have served their purpose.
example: He realized she was just using him; habis manis sepah dibuang.

figurative_meaning: It's better to proceed cautiously than to rush and make mistakes.
example: Take your time with the project; biar lambat asal selamat.

literal_meaning: With a small palm, the winnowing basket is held up.
figurative_meaning: Small efforts can yield big rewards.
example: Every little bit helps; kecil tapak tangan, nyiru ditadahkan.
